revised_title: Cosmic Ray Origin: A Review of Models and Current Understanding
tldr: This article discusses the origin of cosmic rays observed near Earth, focusing on the choice between galactic and metagalactic models. It reviews various models, including galactic models with halo and disk structures, and metagalactic models with universal and local components. The article emphasizes the importance of answering key questions about cosmic-ray trapping regions, sources, propagation, and acceleration mechanisms to better understand the origin of these high-energy particles.
